value.label: Approved Provider - Organisational death or incapacity of proprietor, restructuring, change of key staff involved in decision making, organisational mergers, sale or purchase of age care facilities affecting the provisional allocation.
Contractors - Difficulties in attracting or keeping contractors or tenders including architects, builders, traders people and industrial problems
Finance - Difficulties obtaining finance for construction
Land originally estimated to be suitable but later discovered to be unavailable, eg: bushfire regulations, too close to environmentally/culturally
Applications for building/development approvals to local government authorises and appeals to other agencies as results of decisions lengthy process in regard to resident objections etc

Concurrent refurbishments: additional places being allocated in subsequent rounds requiring re-design, combining provisional allocation construction with refurbishment, That is, other projects happening at the same time.
Physical site problems and weather conditions delaying construction process. Included sites found to be contaminated, on flood plains, subjects to heritage restrictions etc
other reasons, mostly minor delays. Could also include problems in securing agreements to work.
